entries.title: Cramer’s week ahead: Be ‘on your toes’ this earnings period
entries.description: Jim Cramer previewed next week's slate of earnings featuring reports from Microsoft, Southwest Airlines, IBM and more.

entries.title: Feds seize almost $700 million of FTX assets in Sam Bankman-Fried criminal case
entries.description: Federal prosecutors seized nearly $700 million in cash and assets connected to Sam Bankman-Fried, primarily in the form of Robinhood shares.

entries.title: Twitter is down to fewer than 550 full-time engineers
entries.description: Before Musk led a $44 billion leveraged buyout of Twitter last year, Twitter's headcount stood at about 7,500 employees.

entries.title: Bitcoin has climbed more than 10% this week, outperforming stocks
entries.description: Cryptocurrencies rose this week even as stocks retreated from their new year rally and a major crypto lender submitted a long awaited bankruptcy filing.

entries.title: GM, LG end plans for fourth U.S. battery cell plant as automaker seeks new partner
entries.description: GM is expected to continue with its plans to build the plant but is searching for another partner, according to a person familiar with the decision.

entries.title: Google bonus delay has a windfall lesson for workers: ‘Don't have it spent before it gets there,’ says advisor
entries.description: Company bonuses aren't a guarantee, and workers should budget accordingly. The same goes for tax refunds.

entries.title: Wayfair stock climbs after online retailer lays off 1,750 workers
entries.description: Wayfair said Friday it will lay off 1,750 employees to support company-wide restructuring and cost-cutting efforts.

entries.title: Fed Governor Waller backs quarter-point interest rate hike at next meeting
entries.description: The central bank official said during a Council on Foreign Relations event in New York that the Fed can dial down on the size of its rate hikes.

entries.title: GM to invest $918 million in new V-8 gas engines and EV components
entries.description: About $579 million will go toward GM's sixth-generation family of small-block V-8 gas engines that are used in highly profitable vehicles.

entries.title: Here are the layoff severance packages Google, Microsoft, Amazon and other tech giants have promised
entries.description: Laid-off employees across the tech sector enter an uncertain job market. Here's what their previous employers have offered to tide them over.

entries.title: FTC asks judge to hold 'pharma bro' Martin Shkreli in contempt of court for forming new drug firm
entries.description: Martin Shkreli, who was released from prison last year, had been banned "for life" from the drug business as a result of an FTC lawsuit.

entries.title: Amazon's drone delivery unit hit with layoffs just as 10-year-old project finally launches
entries.description: A decade ago, Jeff Bezos touted Amazon's future in drone delivery, but the program has been beset with challenges and now faces job cuts.

entries.title: Goldman Sachs slips on report that the Federal Reserve is investigating its Marcus business
entries.description: The regulator is looking into Goldman Sachs consumer division, Marcus.

entries.title: Germany holds out on Ukraine tanks supply decision despite mounting calls
entries.description: Germany wavered on further EU tank deliveries despite mounting calls from Kyiv and fellow allies.

entries.title: Belarus' exiled opposition leader says trial has 'nothing to do with justice'
entries.description: Belarus' exiled opposition leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya said she has no hope that she will receive a fair trial.

entries.title: 'I wouldn’t change my past if you gave me a trillion dollars,' will.i.am says on his humble beginnings
entries.description: Philanthropist and entertainer will.i.am said on Thursday that he would not change his past and the values he learnt from his family and community as a child.

entries.title: ‘Utterly unprepared’: Larry Summers says another Covid-scale problem is a top economic risk
entries.description: The Harvard economist told the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland that the world is "utterly unprepared" for another Covid-scale disruption.

entries.title: The 'greatest tragedy' would be if central banks don't finish the job on inflation, Larry Summers says
entries.description: Central banks not finishing what they have started on inflation would be the "greatest tragedy" for the global economy, according to former U.S. Treasury Secretary Larry Summers.

entries.title: 'China cannot be out, China must be in': France says it's diverging with Washington on Beijing ties
entries.description: France's President Emmanuel Macron is reportedly planning a trip to China in the coming weeks to discuss energy and trade.

entries.title: Bank of Japan defends yield curve control measures, intends to stick to ultra-easy monetary policy
entries.description: Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda on Friday defended the central bank's decision to widen the trading band in its yield curve control program.

entries.title: Google to lay off 12,000 people — read the memo CEO Sundar Pichai sent to staff
entries.description: Sundar Pichai, Google's CEO, said in an email sent round the company's staff Friday that the firm will lay off 12,000 employees.

entries.title: ChatGPT-style A.I. replaced crypto as the hot tech topic for Davos crowd at 2023's WEF summit
entries.description: This week at the World Economic Forum in Davos, generative AI virtually replaced crypto as the hyped technology of choice for top executives and policymakers.

entries.title: European Central Bank's Lagarde says China's Covid reopening will push inflation higher
entries.description: China's decision to reopen its economy will increase inflation in Europe as they both compete for more energy, the president of the European Central Bank said Friday.

entries.title: Global economic outlook may be less bad — but we're still not in a good place, IMF chief says
entries.description: Economic outlook is "less bad than we feared," Kristalina Georgieva, managing director of the International Monetary Fund, told a closing panel in Davos.

entries.title: Byju's plans to end sponsorship of Indian cricket team jersey, as it puts profitability on cards for 2024
entries.description: Indian education technology start-up Byju's will not renew its jersey sponsorship deal with India's cricket team, the company's co-founder Divya Gokulnath, told CNBC.

entries.title: In hindsight, monetary policy everywhere was too expansionary: Swiss central bank chief
entries.description: Monetary policy has "in hindsight" been "too expansionary," according to the Chairman of the Swiss National Bank Thomas Jordan.

entries.title: One of the UK's largest unions announces 10 more days of strikes
entries.description: One of the U.K.'s largest unions on Friday announced 10 further days of industrial action over the coming weeks, as a standoff between the government and ambulance workers intensifies.

entries.title: Top business leaders and policymakers discuss monetary policy at the World Economic Forum
entries.description: Moderated by CNBC's Joumanna Bercetche, top business leaders and policymakers discuss surging inflation at Davos, Switzerland, and whether a radical rethink is needed by central banks.

entries.title: Tesla will 'keep blowing our minds' despite Elon Musk's distractions, shareholder Tencent says
entries.description: Tencent, known as one of the world's largest gaming and social media firms, invested in Tesla in 2017, taking a 5% stake for around $1.78 billion.

entries.title: Crypto lender Genesis files for bankruptcy in latest blow to Barry Silbert's DCG empire
entries.description: Genesis, the crypto lender owned by DCG, filed for bankruptcy protection, the latest collapse to follow FTX's implosion in November.

entries.title: Looking for a job in India? Hiring for these jobs is on the rise in 2023, according to LinkedIn
entries.description: LinkedIn's latest Jobs on the Rise report saw spikes in hiring for growth specialists, technical workers and health-care professionals in Asia.

entries.title: Silver prices could touch a 9-year high in 2023 — with a bigger upside than gold
entries.description: Silver could hit a nine-year high of $30 per ounce this year and become a better performer than gold.

entries.title: Trump and lawyer sanctioned almost $1 million for 'frivolous' lawsuit against Hillary Clinton
entries.description: Donald Trump had claimed in a dismissed lawsuit that Hillary Clinton and others tried to rig the 2016 presidential election in her favor.

entries.title: Binance was final destination for millions in funds from Bitzlato, exchange shut down for alleged money laundering
entries.description: Blockchain data shows that tens of millions of dollars moved from Bitzlato through intermediaries to Binance.

entries.title: China's reopening 'good news' for growth — but could be inflationary, economists warn at Davos
entries.description: China's decision to welcome tourists again as well as to make it easier for those in the country to travel abroad has been one of the most discussed topics at the World Economic Forum.

entries.title: Netflix blows away expectations on subscriber numbers
entries.description: Netflix reported earnings after the bell. Here are the results.
